item.title: Who Wants A Computer In Their Car?
item.description:
Ford is considering adding in-dash computers to their work trucks and vans, which begs the question: could passenger cars be next? This technology would replace laptops that contractors currently rely on, offering features like digital forms, planning documents, and even invoice printing. While this is helpful for construction workers, an in-dash computer could benefit others, too. Salespeople, consultants, and anyone who conducts business on-the-go could manage messages, documents, orders, receipts, and faxes directly from their vehicles...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/who-wants-a-computer-in-their-car/

item.title: HTC ThunderBolt Screams On LTE
item.description:
The HTC ThunderBolt, a smartphone with lightning-fast speed, embodies the next generation of mobile connectivity. It operates on Verizon’s LTE network with exceptional performance. Not long ago, having a smartphone with cutting-edge 3G broadband was a status symbol. Technology evolves rapidly, and the speed that impressed us a few years ago seems archaic compared to today’s standards. While 3G seemed remarkably fast at the time, its approximate speed of 1 Mbps pales in comparison to 4G’s 10 Mbps...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/htc-thunderbolt-screams-on-lte/
